name: nondramatic
content:
nondramatic adjective
(NOT EXCITING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
without excitement, or not very noticeable: a series of nondramatic events The changes are relatively non-dramatic.
More examplesFewer examplesWe have to think about how we cover non-dramatic events that don't make good news footage, although they have a major impact.My advice is to eliminate drama from your life and give non-dramatic love a chance.He spoke in a nondramatic tone of voice.People waiting for nondramatic operations such as a hip replacement still suffer.
nondramatic adjective
(NOT PLAYS)
Nondramatic pieces of writing are those which are not plays: She is better known for her nondramatic works. nondramatic literature
More examplesFewer examplesWe also study nondramatic forms such as novels and prose. The play is by a literary legend known almost entirely for his non-dramatic fiction.It's interesting to put Shakespeare in the context of contemporary literature, both dramatic and non-dramatic.
